div.p: 62/R45, unit 188, VPRS 1207/P000 inward registered correspondence, VA 865 Department of the Treasurer, Public Record Office, Victoria.

4. Jan 1862
Letter annotated: 'Dr Mueller Obtain Mr Sumner’s sigture to my voucher it will be a sufft. rect. 10.1.62 124 GA'; and 'Is not this a sufft Voucher? [initials illegible]'.

In reply to your circular, dated 27. December 1861, I have the honor to inform you, that the animals for which the advance of £100 was made on 7. Oct. last have as yet not arrived and that I am thus unabled to adjust the account respecting them at present. Meanwhile I beg to transmit to you the receipt of the honorary treasurer of the Acclimation Society, who forwarded the sum for the purchase of animals to India.

div.p: I have the honor to be,
